texts.name: Y Broffwydoliath Fer

texts.adaptation: Welsh prose translation of Revised Prose Version (French) or English Prose Translation; heavily truncated.

texts.name: Darogan y Chwe Brenin
texts.overview: Collection of English and Welsh language prophecies - contains other translated materials. Content with Yorkist sympathies, but also relating to the Revolt of Owain Glyn Dwr.
texts.adaptation: Welsh prose translation of Revised Prose Version (French) or English Prose Translation.

texts.name: Prophecy of the Six Kings (Second Revised Couplet Version])
texts.overview: Collection of English and Welsh language prophecies - contains other translated materials. Content with Yorkist sympathies, including notice of accession of Edward IV
texts.fragment: Treatment of last passages of prophecy, given as complete text.

texts.name: Prophecy of the Six Kings (Second Revised Couplet Version])
texts.overview: Prophecies and poetry in commonplace book
texts.fragment: Treatment of last passages of prophecy, given as complete text.

The Prophecies of Merlin (Revised Prose Version)
texts.overview: Des Grantz Geanz (short prose version); Long Version of the Prose Brut (including a copy of 'Tables', a fourteenth-century game in numbers set by King Arthur, as a chapter); the Gospel of Nicodemus; Letter of Pilate to Claudius; La vengeance nostre seigneur; L'image du monde by Gossuin of Metz.
texts.adaptation: Adaptation: According to Smallwood, adaptation from Prose Version. Smallwood calls this version of the prophecies the Revised Prose Version. It is integrated into the Long Version of the Anglo-Norman Prose Brut (as prophecies told by Merlin to Arthur)

texts.name: Prophecy of the Six Kings to Follow John
texts.overview: English Prose Brut chronicle, Royal declaration/commission in English (against the maintenance of criminals), 'Revelation of Ezra', alphabet of moral advice, 'Prophesie Eldegaris' ('a prophecy in Latin and English, somewhat in the mould of Merlin's prophecies [...and applied here] to the year 1456, when it is said that England/Britain will be conquered by the kings of France, Spain, Scotland and Ireland before one of the kings conquers all the others' (http://www.qub.ac.uk/imagining-history/resources/short/results.php?record=70)

texts.name: Prophecy of the Six Kings to Follow John
texts.overview: This MS has two parts: (1)English Prose Brut chronicle (with John Page's poem, ends imperfectly); (2) contents from the late 13th or early 14th cnetury, (a) Gospel of St Thomas in Latin, and (b) Aelred of Riveaulx's Life of Edward the Confessor (lacks prologue, ends imperfectly)

texts.name: Prophecy of the Six Kings to Follow John
texts.overview: Several items: Table of contents for Brut chronicle; historical notes in Latin; Latin notes and mnemonic verse on the kings of England to Henry VII; English Prose Brut chronicle; notes on the accession of monarchs from Edward IV to Elizabeth I; notes on the kings of England from William I to Henry III; notes on Edward IV's claim to the crowns of England, France, 'castel legiouns', and Normandy; provisions from the treaty of Picquigny; Lydgate's Dietary; extracts from the Polychronicon; copy of a charter from Edward Balliol (grants Edward I overlordship); copy of a letter from Edward I to Pope Boniface VIII; notes on the accession of English monarchs from Richard II to Elizabeth I; alphabetical index to the Polychronicon.

texts.name: Prophecy of the Six Kings to Follow John

texts.compilationDate: s. XV (poss. c. 1420-30, potentially produced in the last years of King Henry VI's reign or the early years of Henry VI)

texts.name: Prophecy of the Six Kings to Follow John
texts.overview: Latin and English verse by John Lydgate (Graunte Cato); Lydgate's Stans Puer ad mensam; Lydgate's A Prayer of the Cross; Whanne lyfe is most louyd; Lydgate, The Marchaunt of Baldok; The Prouerbis of Wysdom; The x Comandements; a table of kings from Brutus to 1461; English Prose Brut chronicel; the xv Oois; The Libel of English Policy, a Prcess of Philosophers.

texts.name: Prophecy of the Six Kings to Follow John
texts.overview: English Prose Brut chronicle, with a 16th C colophon in textura

texts.name: Prophecy of the Six Kings to Follow John
texts.overview: Notes on the seasons, pardons, Aue uerum corpus in Latin; Life of St Katherine (English prose); Life of St James the Apostle (English prose); Life of the Virgin, Annunciation of our Lord, Assumption of our Lady (all English prose); English Prose Brut chronicle; notes on provinces of Ireland and their wonders, and administrative divisions in England; extract from a London Chronicle for mayor John Olney; the sayings of various church fathers on the holy sacrament; beginning of pardon of Corpus Christi; copy of an indenture dated 26 Dec 17 Edweard IV (1477) between Walter Lokington and John Cokerych, wradens of the Fraternity or Guild of the Assumption of Our Lady in St Margaret's Church, in the close of St Peter's, Westminster, and James Fytt, citizen and tailor of London.
